Key Match Events: The USA caused a huge, historic shock in the T20 World Cup with a thrilling Super Over win over Pakistan in Texas.
The game went to the extra over after both sides made 159 in their 20 overs at Grand Prairie Stadium.
USA scored 14 in the final over to tie Pakistan’s total.
In the Super Over, USA made 18 for one, with Aaron Jones on 11 before being run out and seven runs coming via extras.
Iftikhar Ahmed took Pakistan to five for none off three balls before he was brilliantly caught by Nitish Kumar.
USA bowler Saurabh Netravalkar restricted Pakistan to 13 for one in the Super Over.
USA captain Monank Patel won the official player of the match award.
A six from Jones off the third last ball and a four from Kumar off the final delivery tied the match and forced the Super Over.
Post-Match Reflections: USA captain Monank Patel described the result as a 'big achievement' and expressed pride in the team's performance.
Pakistan captain Babar Azam bemoaned his side’s batting performance and credited USA for their superior performance.
Patel is confident their win over Pakistan will prove a milestone moment for the game in the USA.
Patel emphasized that beating Pakistan in a World Cup will open many doors for USA cricket.
Miscellaneous Highlights: This is the first time that the ICC has staged a major tournament in the United States.
The USA had already turned heads ahead of the tournament by beating Bangladesh 2-1 in their warm-up series last month.
The USA’s next match is against India at the Nassau County Cricket Stadium on Long Island.
The ICC has promised to resolve issues with the pitch at the Nassau County Cricket Stadium following initial matches.
